title: The Lost Heir

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: We have to go back to the desert. We still have something we need to do.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: It'd be great if it were to find Ashnard's son. I'm burning up out here.

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: I'm not sure what it is. I see a lot of images, stacked on top of each other. It's hard to see what they all are. There's danger, battles, and terrible sadness, but also...hope. Whatever our destiny is, I know we'll find it in the desert. Let's go.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: I understand, Micaiah. I'll tell everyone to make ready.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: We've already been north, where we met Prince Rafiel and his party. That leaves east or south... Which way?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: What is it, Volug? Is something wrong? Volug says he senses beorc to the south. A lot of beorc.

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: That settles it then. We'll head south.

intro.speaker: Zihark
intro.line: Impressive as ever, General Tauroneo. However, we can't hold out forever. We are seriously outnumbered. It's time we put these vermin in their place. Are you ready, Jill?

intro.speaker: Sothe
intro.line: Who could the Begnion soldiers be attacking out here in the middle of nowhere?

intro.speaker: Micaiah
intro.line: Whoever it is, we have to help them!

battle.speaker: Sothe
battle.line: wait a moment. Those people fighting the Begnion soldiers... It couldn't be... That white armor... Only certain generals were allowed to wear it. I may very well know that soldier. Micaiah: Really? Well then, all the more reason to help them. Let's hurry!

battle.speaker: Micaiah
battle.line: Really? Well then, all the more reason to help them. Let’s hurry!

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Ah…

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Ilyana! It’s been a while.

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Too long, Zihark…

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: So you remember my name!

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: How could I forget you, Zihark? Why, I think of you often! You treated me to food…glorious food… On 23 separate occasions! But who’s counting?

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Apparently, you are. And now, might I request something in return?

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: Well, um, yes. What exactly did you have in mind?

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: For you, something sweet! You join our merry band, and together, we fight for Daein’s freedom. I’m counting on you, my dear. You wouldn’t want to disappoint me, would you?

battle-talk.speaker: Ilyana
battle-talk.line: …Ah…er… What?

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Hey, Jill? Jill Fizzart? It is you, isn’t it?

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: Sothe?!

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Haven’t seen you since the war ended.

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: That does bring back memories… What are you doing out here in the middle of nowhere?

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: We heard that King Ashnard’s orphan was in need of soldiers. We came to find out if it’s true.

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: The prince? He’s just inside the fort.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Then it’s true?

battle-talk.speaker: Jill
battle-talk.line: It is. Will you help us protect him?

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Of course.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: General Tauroneo!

battle-talk.speaker: Tauroneo
battle-talk.line: Well, if it isn't our little Sothe! I'd never have thought to see you here!

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: General, these ruins you're defending... Do they hold hope for Daein?

battle-talk.speaker: Tauroneo
battle-talk.line: They do. In fact, these walls hold what may well be Daein's only hope.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: I see. Then we must protect this place at all costs.

battle-talk.speaker: Tauroneo
battle-talk.line: Indeed.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Need a hand?

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Sothe? Where did you come from? What are you doing here?

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Hello, Zihark. I see you’re fighting Begnion soldiers. I assume you’re siding with Daein here?

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: That’s right. This is my homeland. These are my people.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Oh, really? I didn’t know you were from Daein.

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: Yep, I’m a Daein, through and through.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: All that time we fought together, and I never knew.

battle-talk.speaker: Zihark
battle-talk.line: That’s because I never told you. At any rate, let’s rejoin the fight. We can talk later.

battle-talk.speaker: Sothe
battle-talk.line: Ah, yes…

boss.speaker: Wystan
boss.line: You're a tenacious bunch, I'll grant you. Daein isn't known for winning its wars... So why do you keep trying?

boss.speaker: Wystan
boss.line: Absurd... One must not...meet failure...against the tattered remnants...of a conquered...coun...try...

boss.speaker: Wystan
boss.line: Come to help the helpless? A dainty little flower like you is hardly worth the effort! Well, do your worst.

boss.speaker: Micaiah
boss.line: What is Begnion doing out here in the desert? Is there something or someone in these ruins that you're interested in?

boss.speaker: Wystan
boss.line: That's none of your business, little girl. We'll slash our way in no matter what anybody else wants!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: General Tauroneo! Zihark and Jill, too. I haven't seen you since the war ended three years ago. Who would've thought we'd meet again in such a desolate place?

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: Sothe, you've grown. I hardly recognized you.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: We have a lot of catching up to do, but for now, I'll just make introductions. This is Micaiah...

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: And who have we here? Hmmm?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Step back. Who are you?

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: Lord Izuka, there's no need for concern. This young man is Sothe. We know him well. Sothe, may I introduce Lord Izuka. He is advisor and close confidant to Prince Pelleas, Ashnard's son.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah! Did you hear that? The prince IS here. Still, I can't believe we ran into you three--of all people--guarding the prince. What a lucky coincidence. General Tauroneo, we came here because we heard the prince was gathering forces in the desert. We want to help you in your efforts. Will you let us join you?

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: Certainly. Daein needs all the courage we can muster. Let us join forces.

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: See here! What do you think you're doing?! You can't just ignore me and start making decisions! These people are suspicious, verrry suspicious. You're all Begnion spies, aren't you? Come now, tell the truth!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: We're the Dawn Brigade. We'd never work for those filthy curs!

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: The Dawn Brigade! But how? Then, perhaps the girl... No! Could it be? Are you the Silver-Haired Maiden? Do you have the healing touch of Sacrifice?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Excuse me!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Take your hands off her!

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: What a coincidence! Or is it fate? Or maybe it's my unrivaled skill as a revolutionary organizer? With the Silver-Haired Maiden at our side, we'll surely win over the people of Daein! And then...yes! Incite scattered rebel movements, mm-hm, and then, further...the future of...change...

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Is he...touched in the head?

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: Oh, my, but yes. I'll beckon to...no, demand that the vicious scalawags...surrender! Perfect! I am a genius! Come, come, my dear maiden! You must meet the prince!

end.speaker: Tauroneo
end.line: Goddess help me, that man could try the patience of a stone.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Hmmm...

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: Look here! Before you stands the one and only, the grand Prince Pelleas, true-blooded son of the king of Daein. And here we have the consort and queen of our late King Ashnard, Lady Almedha. And look at you! You're standing? Did the desert dry out your brains? Kneel ye before these royal personages!

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: It's all right, Izuka. Please, don't stand on ceremony. I didn't know I was a prince until very recently. So, really, I'm not used to any of this.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What do you mean?

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Until a half year ago--that is, until Izuka found me--I was raised as a normal commoner. To be frank, it still doesn't feel real to me. That I...I myself could be the son of King Ashnard. It's a little overwhelming.

end.speaker: Almedha
end.line: Don't talk nonsense, darling. You are my own sweet, sweet son, Prince Pelleas, yes... I'll never let you be parted from me, no, never ever again...

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: Ahem! Enough of the pleasantries, then. Shall we get down to business? Well then, Micaiah of the Dawn Brigade. I henceforth appoint thee to the post of Vice-General of the Daein Liberation Army!

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Excuse me?! What do you mean by that?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Wait a moment! I appreciate the offer, Izuka, but I'm afraid I cannot accept. I have no war experience and no knowledge of battle tactics. Daein needs a general with both.

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: Are you not a member of the heroic Dawn Brigade, whose conquests precede them?! Do you not want to save the people of Daein?! Serve the prince, and you can step out of the shadows and face the empire boldly, without shame! Why hesitate?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: This is a thinly veiled scheme...and I see right through it. You just want Micaiah to serve as a figurehead for your revolution.

end.speaker: Izuka
end.line: Is that a problem?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Yes, that's a problem! She's not some fancy stoneware for you to set on display. If you're going to do this...then I cannot sign on.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Exactly.

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Micaiah, please, wait! That isn't what we meant. You're not the only one who knows nothing about battle. I don't either. But if I don't act, the devastation of Daein will grow ever worse. So, I have to be brave. Please, I'm asking you to do the same, Micaiah... For the sake of the future of Daein, will you join our cause?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...Prince Pelleas...I will.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: Micaiah?!

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: Thank you.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: And in return, will you ensure, beyond a shadow of a doubt, that Daein will be freed from the rule of the Begnion Empire?

end.speaker: Pelleas
end.line: I promise.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I trust in your word.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I can't believe you!

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Sothe, why are you so angry about this?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: You have to ask? You know we can't live in the public eye. Doing something that will deliberately make you stand out... I'm just saying, it isn't like you, Micaiah.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: When we were separated during the war, you changed, Sothe. And I changed too. I want to protect Daein more than anything. Our people must be saved, and if I can help in that effort, I will.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: So much so that you'll risk your life and sacrifice who you are?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: Yes. But that isn't all. Prince Pelleas cherishes the same wish that I do. I can feel it. Deep in his heart, he wants to save Daein. If we work together, I know that we can do it.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: And you don't hear that voice we spoke of? The voice that warns you of impending danger?

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: It's all right, Sothe. The visions I see spreading out before us... most of them shine with hope.

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: All right. I trust you. More importantly, I believe in you. I won't resist anymore. But let me just say one thing.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I will protect you.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: I know that! Why do you think you need to say it?

end.speaker: Sothe
end.line: I just wanted to make sure you knew.

end.speaker: Micaiah
end.line: ...Thank you, Sothe.

narration: Three years past, Daein mustered all of its formidable military might and cut a bloody swath through neighboring Crimea in a sudden invasion. Daein was defeated, however, and the dreams of its ruler, Mad King Ashnard, died with him.

Ashnard's son, Pelleas, possesses a gentle sincerity that is a bright counterpoint to his late father's violence and duplicity. Ill-suited though he seems for these troubled times, his presence is a welcome sight of Micaiah's eyes. Pelleas, declared rightful heir to the throne, finds his name becoming a rallying cry for Daein. At his side is the only person he believes can lead his Liberation Army...the Silver-Haired Maiden.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Hey, Micaiah. I sold the treasures we took from the ruins. We have traveling cash now.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: How did we do?

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: We have 10,000 in gold.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Great! That’ll help a lot.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: Maybe. We could use more.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Sothe, 10,000 is plenty. We just need enough money to live on. More than that, and the soul becomes impoverished.

conversation.speaker: Sothe
conversation.line: I know, I know. We should be rich of heart and poor of pocket… Me, I just follow your orders.

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: So, you’re returning to the desert?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes, we must go back.

conversation.speaker: Rafiel
conversation.line: My dear…

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: Yes, Rafiel, I know. Micaiah, I have a question. How can we help you in this fight?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What? But…

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: I know you probably don’t want to be seen with laguz. But we cannot just sit on our paws, so to speak, while our allies are in danger.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I appreciate that, but…

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: No? Fine. Sorry to bother you.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No, no. It’s not what you think. Please don’t apologize. It’s just that…

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: What is it, Volug?

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: I see. That is a good idea.

conversation.speaker: Rafiel
conversation.line: Oh, yes. I agree. That’s a wonderful idea.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Yes? Volug? What’s going on?

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: Micaiah, it will not seem so strange if you travel into the desert with this dog at your side, will it?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: What?!

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: As you know, we laguz fight only in our shifted forms. However, we can’t remain in that state for very long. It is too exhausting. Volug, however, has halfshifted. When he does this, he can remain in beast form all day long.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Queen Nailah, I appreciate you help–

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: He is not as strong in this transitional form. Even so, he is still more than a match for any beorc.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: How could you call Volug a dog?!

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: I know. He’s not as friendly as a dog. And I don’t know if he’s housebroken. But he can fight!

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: That is not what I meant.

conversation.speaker: Nailah
conversation.line: Micaiah. We wish you good luck. Volug, guard her well.

conversation.speaker: Rafiel
conversation.line: Do be careful.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: I will. Thank you. Volug, is she always so…blunt?

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: So, you are an old friend of Laura’s?

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Yes. I’m afraid I must apologize for my poor choice in employers.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Please don’t worry about it. After all, you saved us.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: When I saw Laura, I simply couldn’t stand by any longer.

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: Thank you, Aran.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: I’ve been meaning to ask you, Laura. What’s become of your church? I’d heard that, since the occupation, most of Daein’s clergy have been excommunicated and sent to prisons. I know that the empire sent its own replacements. Was your church affected?

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: No, thankfully. Our congregation would always say… "The clergy of the empire wouldn’t even consider coming to a dingy church in a backwater village like this! You’re been spared, Minister!" Ha ha ha… We extended our prayer time to thank the goddess for saving our church.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Ah… I see.

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: Oh, Aran. I meant to tell you, now that you’re one of us, you’ll have to become a bandit.

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: Excuse me?

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: I’m sorry…a bandit?

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: There’s really no need to worry. The Dawn Brigade bandits have virtuous people like Micaiah in their ranks.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Er… Okaaaay…

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: No, we’re not ban--

conversation.speaker: Laura
conversation.line: But always remember, Aran. We must strive above all else to be honorable bandits. For the future of Daein.

conversation.speaker: Aran
conversation.line: Uh… All right…

conversation.speaker: Micaiah
conversation.line: …Bandits?

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Oh, man… Where is this prince, anyway? I wanna go home to Nevassa.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: A long-lost prince of Daein? Who even knows if he really exists…

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Of course he does!

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: How do you know? Do you have any proof?

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Simple. Micaiah told us we should look for the prince. So, it’s gotta be true!

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: Yeah, you’re right. Her farsight is always spot on.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Even if we don’t find him, there’s no need to worry… ’cause I’m here!

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: Excuse me?

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Since we left Nevassa, my swordsmanship has pretty much improved tenfold! By the time we get back home, I’ll be invincible! I’ll kick those tyrants out of Daein with my own two hands and one sharp blade!

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: It’s great to have a dream, Edward…but you should wake up now!

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Are you saying I’m not good enough?!

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: No. I’m saying there’s a limit to how much one person can achieve. I’m going to do the best I can, but… It doesn’t matter how strong the two of us become. We can’t change what’s going on in Daein. Not by ourselves.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Well, duh! I’m just saying it’s a goal! You know? Just something to work toward.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: Sure. But you shouldn’t say such things lightly. It might be just a joke to you. It’s not to me.

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Wow. Sorry.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: Ya, well. So am I. I didn’t mean to get so serious. All the fighting…it just gets to me sometimes.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Hey, boys. What is this, a funeral? What’s with all the doom and gloom?

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: Nolan.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: I couldn’t help but overhear, and I have a little to say on the subject. You’re right, each of us can only achieve so much on our own. But you boys are still young. Don’t let go of your hopes and dreams. Not yet, anyway.

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: But…

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Listen, there’s no way we can free Daein by ourselves. But we CAN find King Ashnard’s lost son and fight against the empire under Daein’s banner. If we gather our strength, we stand a better chance of freeing our motherland. Now then, how’s that for a little motivation to get your sorry backsides into training harder?

conversation.speaker: Edward
conversation.line: That’s great! Thanks, Nolan. You’re pretty smart for an old man!

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: Hey, now… None of that, or I’ll show you what an old man can do! Leonardo, are you feeling better?

conversation.speaker: Leonardo
conversation.line: Yes, sir. Thank you, Nolan. I guess age does make you wiser.

conversation.speaker: Nolan
conversation.line: How old do you think I am, anyway? Now I’m getting depressed…
